channel.title: How to Delete All Inactive Accounts With 2 Clicks
channel.description:
This is a Windows Batch Code [.BAT]
This will remove all accounts that haven't been edited within the time you set.
I'll explain the Code: [Red is safe to edit]
-- @echo off
forfiles.exe /p "C:\Users\*****\Desktop\******\characters" /s /m *.* /d -14 /c "cmd /c del /q @path"
pause ---
The Path is where your Server Files are. The red 14 is the time you set. 14 is 14 days if you want 5 days you put 5 and that will delete all accounts that havent been edited [logged in] within 5 days
[code] @echo off
forfiles.exe /p "C:\PATH TO YOUR CHARACTERS FOLDER HERE" /s /m *.* /d -TIME IN DAYS /c "cmd /c del /q @path"
pause [/code]

item.title: How to Delete All Inactive Accounts With 2 Clicks
item.dc:creator: @stewie0888 stewie0888
item.description:
@stewie0888 wrote:

This is a Windows Batch Code [.BAT]

This will remove all accounts that haven’t been edited within the time you set.

I’ll explain the Code: [Red is safe to edit]

–
@echo off

forfiles.exe /p “C:\Users*****\Desktop******\characters” /s /m . /d -14 /c “cmd /c del /q @path”

pause

The Path is where your Server Files are.
The red 14 is the time you set. 14 is 14 days if you want 5 days you put 5 and that will delete all accounts that havent been edited [logged in] within 5 days

@echo off

forfiles.exe /p "C:\PATH TO YOUR CHARACTERS FOLDER HERE" /s /m *.* /d -TIME IN DAYS /c "cmd /c del /q @path"

pause
